input_text:
Job Title: Regional Sales Manager - Foot & Ankle - Northeast

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
CONMED Foot & Ankle is seeking a Regional Sales Manager to lead our distributor network in the Northeast United states.. CONMED is a leader in medical technology. We empower healthcare providers worldwide to deliver exceptional outcomes for patients. If you are committed to making a difference, you'll find a group of people here that shares your passion for meaningful work. You'll be supported by a leadership team that promotes engagement through professional development, new challenges, and growth opportunities over the course of your career. We value diversity of thought, background, and experience. Come inspire us through your dedication, creativity, and exceptional performance - we'll do the same for you!

What You Will Do

Quantify and monitor personal Regional performance objectives and expectations according to Corporate sales performance plans and policies.Participate in the formulation of the Regional sales performance plan including sales forecasts, quotas, commission, incentive bonus, and reporting progress to objectives.Establish Agent requirements and lead the effort in identifying and qualifying new Agents, monitor and document Agent performance, and recommend termination of non-performing distributors.Provide support and training for new Agent groups and new sales reps within existing Agent groups.Communicate sales quotas, consignment inventory parameters, demo product policies, lead generation and follow up, and performance concerns with Agent.Monitor and manage the Agent consignment inventory.Active participation with Customer Service and Accounts Receivable in the collection of Purchase Order numbers and payment of invoices.Provide field intelligence relating to In2Bones and competitive activities, Surgeon comments and feedback related to In2Bones product usage and surgical techniques.Monitor Regional expenses to adhere to Corporate budget and FDA guidelines.Coordinate In2Bones and Agent attendance for local and Regional meetings and conventions.

What You Need

Bachelor’s Degree from Accredited University (MBA or MA preferred)5+ years of medical device sales experienceExperience managing a network of independent sales distributors is preferred

Benefits

CONMED offers a wide array of benefits to fit your unique needs. Visit our Benefits Page for more information.

Competitive compensationExcellent healthcare including medical, dental, vision and prescription coverageShort & long term disability plus life insurance -- cost paid fully by CONMEDRetirement Savings Plan (401K) -- CONMED matches your contributions dollar for dollar, with the potential for up to 7% per pay periodEmployee Stock Purchase Plan -- allows stock purchases at discounted priceTuition assistance for undergraduate and graduate level courses

Know someone at CONMED? 

Have them submit you as a referral before applying for this position to be eligible for our Employee Referral Program incentives!

CONMED is an Equal Opportunity Employer & an Affirmative Action Employer. CONMED is a strong advocate of workforce diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, citizenship status, or veteran status.

If you feel you need a reasonable accommodation pursuant to the ADA, you are encouraged to contact us at 800-325-5900 option #3.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Regional Sales Manager - Foot & Ankle - Northeast
output_json.summary: CONMED Foot & Ankle seeks a Regional Sales Manager to lead the distributor network in the Northeast United States.
job_responsibilities: Quantify and monitor personal Regional performance objectives and expectations according to Corporate sales performance plans and policies.
Participate in the formulation of the Regional sales performance plan including sales forecasts, quotas, commission, incentive bonus, and reporting progress to objectives.
Establish Agent requirements and lead the effort in identifying and qualifying new Agents, monitor and document Agent performance, and recommend termination of non-performing distributors.
Provide support and training for new Agent groups and new sales reps within existing Agent groups.
Communicate sales quotas, consignment inventory parameters, demo product policies, lead generation and follow up, and performance concerns with Agent.
Monitor and manage the Agent consignment inventory.
Active participation with Customer Service and Accounts Receivable in the collection of Purchase Order numbers and payment of invoices.
Provide field intelligence relating to In2Bones and competitive activities, Surgeon comments and feedback related to In2Bones product usage and surgical techniques.
Monitor Regional expenses to adhere to Corporate budget and FDA guidelines.
Coordinate In2Bones and Agent attendance for local and Regional meetings and conventions.
benefits: Excellent healthcare including medical, dental, vision, and prescription coverage
Short & long term disability plus life insurance -- cost paid fully by CONMED
Retirement Savings Plan (401K) -- CONMED matches your contributions dollar for dollar, with the potential for up to 7% per pay period
Employee Stock Purchase Plan -- allows stock purchases at discounted price
Tuition assistance for undergraduate and graduate level courses
output_json.company_information: CONMED is a leader in medical technology empowering healthcare providers worldwide to deliver exceptional outcomes for patients.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: CONMED is an Equal Opportunity Employer & an Affirmative Action Employer. CONMED is a strong advocate of workforce diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, citizenship status, or veteran status.
